We have been informed by Edwards Air Force Base that in commemoration of the 70th Anniversary of supersonic flight, they will be conducting a flyover consisting of U.S. Air Force fighter jets over selected schools in Southern California to promote STEM (Science Technology Engineering, and Math). Oak Park High School and Medea Creek Middle School have been selected as schools that will be in the path of the flyover.

We have been informed by the Air Force that this will take place between 12:18 -12:28 PM on FRIDAY, OCTOBER 13. Airplanes in the formation will include an F-16 Fighting Falcon, F-15 Eagle, F-22 Raptor, and F-35 Lightning II.

Depending on their altitude, it is possible that the jets will be visible and certainly audible throughout Oak Park and surrounding areas.

For more information on this event click here: https://sites.google.com/a/412tw.us/70ssf/home
